title: Hierarchical Instructional Design Approach for Enhanced Interactivity

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service and in-service science teachers emphasizing the enhancement of interactive design competencies. Operated with a focus on practical training using real-time video conferencing tools and personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can interpret the five stages of a hierarchical design approach (control layer, strategy layer, representation layer, etc.) and apply them to actual science classes.
Learners can utilize control layer theory (interface design, interaction patterns, etc.) for designing interactive lessons in online environments.
Learners can develop formative assessment tools to evaluate learner engagement and build feedback systems.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
